security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with prompt instructions. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external dependencies. The file I/O patterns shown are pseudocode examples for Claude prompts, not actual file system operations.

content.value_statement: Emergency responders need quick access to critical health data during emergencies. This skill extracts allergies, medications, implants, and conditions from health records to generate printable emergency cards in multiple formats.
actual_capabilities: Extract critical allergies (level 3-4 severity) from health records
List current active medications with dosage and frequency
Identify medical implants that affect treatment
Generate cards in JSON, text, HTML, and QR code formats
Prioritize information by medical emergency severity
Create specialized cards for children, elderly, and severe allergy patients
limitations: Requires pre-existing health data files in the data directory
Does not provide medical advice or treatment recommendations
Does not verify or validate medical information accuracy
PDF generation requires additional tools not included in skill

output: Current Medications: Aspirin 100mg once daily, Amlodipine 5mg twice daily

best_practices: Update emergency cards every 3 months or after any health information changes
Store digital versions in cloud storage and keep printed copies in wallet or phone case
Always include emergency contact information with partially masked phone numbers for privacy
anti_patterns: Using the skill without first having health data files properly organized
Relying on emergency cards as the sole source of medical information during emergencies
Including unverified or self-diagnosed conditions that have not been confirmed by healthcare providers

faq.question: What data sources does this skill use?
faq.answer: It reads profile.json, allergies.json, medications.json, radiation records, surgery records, and discharge summaries from the data directory.

faq.question: What formats can the card be generated in?
faq.answer: Supported formats include JSON (structured data), Text (readable with Unicode borders), HTML (printable with styling), and QR code (for phone scanning).

faq.question: Is my health data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. All processing happens locally through Claude. Data is only saved to your local device when you choose to export it.

faq.question: How often should I update my emergency card?
faq.answer: Update your card whenever health information changes, at minimum every 3 months, and before any travel or medical procedures.

faq.question: Can this skill replace my medical records?
faq.answer: No. Emergency cards are summary documents for first responders. Always maintain complete medical records with healthcare providers.

faq.question: What makes this different from medical alert bracelets?
faq.answer: This card provides more complete information including all medications, multiple allergies, implants, and emergency contacts in formats that are easy to update and share digitally.
